TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit StrongNameMembershipCondition extends System.Object implements class System.Security.ISecurityEncodable, class System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable, class System.Security.Policy.IMembershipCondition

Docs.summary: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its strong name. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Strong names are well suited to specifying code assemblies to which you give a rich set of powerful permissions. Since strong names are cryptographically verified, attackers cannot impersonate rightful assemblies and use their permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: public StrongNameMembershipCondition (System.Security.Permissions.StrongNamePublicKeyBlob blob, string name, Version version);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Permissions.StrongNamePublicKeyBlob blob, string name, class System.Version version) cil managed

Docs.param: The strong name public key blob of the software publisher.
The simple name section of the strong name.
The version number of the strong name.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the strong name public key blob, name, and version number that determine membership.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Strong names are well suited to specifying code assemblies to which you give a rich set of powerful permissions. Since strong names are cryptographically verified, attackers cannot impersonate rightful assemblies and use their permissions.
The `name` and `version` parameters are optional. For example, you can create a <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongNameMembershipCondition> that checks for <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongNameMembershipCondition.PublicKey%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongNameMembershipCondition.Name%2A> (but not <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongNameMembershipCondition.Version%2A>) by passing `null` into the `version` parameter. If `name` is an empty string (""), an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.

Docs.exception:
The parameter is .
-or-
The parameter is an empty string ("").

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Check(class System.Security.Policy.Evidence evidence) cil managed

Docs.param: The against which to make the test.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
Docs.returns: if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This membership condition tests only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongName> evidence object.
The membership condition is satisfied if the specified evidence contains a <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongName> with the same <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongName> (public key, name, and version) as specified by the <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongNameMembershipCondition>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For two <xref:System.Security.Policy.StrongName> classes to be equal, their name, version, and public key blob must match exactly.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the of the for which the membership condition tests.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A blob is cryptographic information that uniquely specifies the public key of the software publisher.
Blobs differ from certificates in that the blob only has information about the public key; the certificate also includes information that associates a name of the holder with the key, as well as information to verify the certificate.
